feature.name: Create ANT script to build a project
feature.remarks: Ant build file should be able to rebuild the project. The required libraries should be specified in a separate .property file.

feature.name: Setup web application
feature.remarks: Ant build file should include a task to create a .war file

feature.name: Setup a database for FDDPMA
feature.remarks: Create these attributes: - a document that describes how to setup database - SQL script to create tables, initially let it have one table only.

feature.name: Create ANT Script to deploy a project
feature.remarks: Ant build file should have a task to deploy the war file to local Tomcat installation

feature.name: Setup UnitTest framework
feature.remarks: Create a task inside of ant build file that would run the tests and produce HTML report.

feature.name: Setup property file for application logging
feature.remarks: this should be regular log4j.properties file

feature.name: Write messages to a log file according to severity level
JSF: Create a component that displays navigation tree
JSF: Create a tabbed notebook component
feature.remarks: Tab component should support tabs located at the top or at the bottom of the page

feature.name: JSF: Create input components
feature.remarks: Use standard JSF components whenever possible

feature.name: JSF: Create sortable table component
feature.remarks: Use standard JSF table compoent if possible

feature.name: JSF: Create genaral screen layout for FDDPMA
feature.remarks: It should support header at the top, navigation pane at the left, footer at the pottom. The rest of screen space is a work area

Use standard weights for feature milestones:
Walkthrough: 1% Design: 40% Design inspection: 3% Coding: 45% Code review: 10% Promomote to build: 1%

fddpma:workpackage.name: FS001 - Setting up build process
fddpma:workpackage.remarks:
FS003 Setup a database for FDDPMA - create a document that describes DB setup; - find a tool to visually develop database schemas
FS005 Setup UnitTest framework: Think about what kind of testing do we want - web based testing (Cactus framework) or - standalone testing (pure junit)

fddpma:workpackage.name: PM004 Constructing a tree of projects
PM010 Managing workpackages
fddpma:workpackage.remarks:
PM032 List all workpackages for project: This feature includes both - displaying list of workpackages in the navigation tree - displaying list of workpackages when user clicks on "Workpackages" node
PM034 Delete a workpackage from project: Confirmation message should be displayed

fddpma:workpackage.name: PM012 Managing code ownership
fddpma:workpackage.remarks:
PM052 Import code units to a project: We cannot browse user's computer harddrive to import the name of files. Instead, we will provide a hint how to obtain a list of files (for example using DIR command). Then user can obtain a list of files and paste it in FDDPMA.
PM053 Assign an owner to a code unit Provide a dropdown with names of project members. Do not warry to filter by roles for now.

fddpma:workpackage.name: DM001 Uploading documents
fddpma:workpackage.remarks: DM002 Verify uniqueness of the document: the documents in the database should be unique: if user uploads one and the same document twice (say, for two different work packages) only one copy should be stored in DB.

fddpma:workpackage.name: PM013 Working with worksheet
fddpma:workpackage.remarks:
PM057 Generate a worksheet: The workplace for workpackage IS a worksheet.
PM060 Display attached document: do not display real document ids in browser: a user may replace ID with another one and see somebody else's documents. Instead, develop a mechanism for obfuscating document ids.
PM061 Update worksheet description: This is done on "Settings" tab; already implemented.
PM062 Add code unit to a worksheet: - add a many-to-many relationship betwenn tables FDDPMA_WORKPACKAGE and FDDPMA_CODE_UNIT - when workpackage is delete, all assigments of dource code should be deleted - when source code unit is deleted, all of its assignments should be deleted
PM065 Print worksheet for a workpackage: Print Worksheet" button is left uniplemented untill the following workpackage where we will genarate a PDF document.

fddpma:workpackage.name: DM002 Generating documents in PDF
fddpma:workpackage.remarks: - Implement a base class for report genaration; - Implement a servler/jsp to display the generated PDF report;

fddpma:workpackage.name: RG001 Generating worksheet report
fddpma:workpackage.remarks:
The unit test cannot really do a good job in this workpackage. The layout of the document should be verified by human. However, the unit test could verify that the report contains teh expected text, like names of features, documents, etc.
Attached the workpackage workseet report created by unit test.

fddpma:workpackage.name: PS001 Collecting statistics
fddpma:workpackage.remarks:
This workpackage also has to implement the storage for a collected statistics: Implement ReportSystem that would store statistics on per-report bases. It should be able to store these values: - project - Report type - date when statistics is collected - data XML that keeps all teh collected data.
This package also has to implement a background statistics collector that collect statistics for projects right after midnight. This would allow the statistics to be collected even if no user is logged into application.
The data XML may be specific for each report, or it may be uniformed for similar reports. An example of such XML would be:
<project name="fddpma" dateCollected="Jan 11, 2005"> <businessArea prefix="BA" name="Business Area 1"> <activity name="Activity 1" targetDate="Dec 2004" featuresTotal="11" featuresNotStarted="0" featuresInProgress="0" featuresBegindSchedule="0" featuresCompleted="11" completePercent="100" completionDate="Dec 2004" owner="SK">
<activity name="Activity 2" targetDate="Dec 2004" featuresTotal="11" featuresNotStarted="0" featuresInProgress="0" featuresBegindSchedule="0" featuresCompleted="11" completePercent="100" completionDate="Dec 2004" owner="SK"> </businessArea> </project>
The statistics for business area and for the project may be obtained by aggregation of lower-level statistics.

fddpma:workpackage.name: RG002 Creating Parking Lot Report
fddpma:workpackage.remarks:
PG018 - generate an image using PDF vector graphic capabilities. Do not insert JPEG images into PDF.
The example of how report should look like is attached.

fddpma:workpackage.name: RG003 Creating progress summary report
fddpma:workpackage.remarks: Make sure that the report may be generated for a single project, or for a group of projects. The latter means that reports for individual projects are simply concatenated.

fddpma:workpackage.name: RG004 Generating trend report
fddpma:workpackage.remarks:
RG016 - trend report should support collecting data. The data should be returned in XML format and represent a snapshot of current project statistics. The xml should be such that FeatureStatistics object can be created from it.
RG017 - the generation of the report starts from retrieving all the previously generated data for the project in XML format (see feature RG016). Then convert the found XML snippets to a list of FeatureStatistics objects. For each object output one line in the report.

fddpma:workpackage.name: RG005 Generating PlanView report
fddpma:workpackage.remarks: The fragment of how the report should look like is attached.

fddpma:workpackage.name: RG006 Selecting report
fddpma:workpackage.remarks: Implement the two views: - one allows to generate the current versions for the reports - another allows to find and view previous versions of reports

fddpma:workpackage.name: Create end user licence agreement
fddpma:workpackage.remarks: If possible, use one of the public licenses, for example GPL

fddpma:workpackage.name: Create documentation
fddpma:workpackage.remarks:
Use Harvard's template to write Thesis document. The document should also include:
- User guide: screenshots of FDDPMA views with description. - Installtion guide: use the existing document, complete it. - Modeling notes (see attached) - Mockup screens: only coplw of them to show how design was transformed into real application. (see attached)
